content:
Former members of the Church of Scientology and whistleblowers have played a significant role in the legal battles that the organization has faced. Many of these individuals have come forward with allegations of abuse, harassment, and other illegal activities, providing testimony and evidence in various lawsuits against the Church. This testimony and evidence have helped to bring to light many of the problematic practices of the Church of Scientology, including its alleged use of forced labor, its harassment of critics and former members, and its exploitation of its members financially.

Former members and whistleblowers have also provided important context and insight into the inner workings of the Church, helping to expose its secretive and cult-like practices. Their involvement has helped to draw public attention to the Church's actions, resulting in increased scrutiny and legal action against the organization.

In some cases, former members and whistleblowers have also filed lawsuits against the Church themselves, either to seek justice for their own experiences or to help bring about change within the organization. These lawsuits have often been high-profile and have helped to further highlight the issues facing the Church of Scientology.

Overall, the involvement of former members and whistleblowers has been instrumental in the legal battles faced by the Church of Scientology, helping to shed light on its problematic practices and hold it accountable for its actions.
